notes: Successive attacks with Desolator do not stack the debuff, but refresh the duration instead.
The attacks first apply the debuff, then their own damage.
Works against wards, buildings, and allied units.
Replaces the projectile particle of ranged heroes with a red projectile.
Does not stack with the armor reduction of Blight Stone. If both debuffs are present, Blight Stone's debuff does not reduce armor.
Fully stacks with any other item.
abilities.description: Your attacks reduce the target's armor by 6 for 7 seconds.

name: Desolator
description: A wicked weapon, used in torturing political criminals.
trivia: This item was named "Stygian Desolator" in DotA, a reference to an item from Anarchy Online. This name is now used by an upgraded version of the Desolator, which drops as a neutral item.
tips: Corruption works against buildings, making it a great pushing tool. Split-pushing heroes can benefit a lot from it, allowing them to take towers down much quicker.
The Corruption debuff lasts quite long, so sometimes it is better to get the debuff on multiple enemies, instead of focusing only one target in team fights.
This item works well in combination with critical strike items and abilities, such as Mortal Strike and Daedalus.
